2000.info: The start game event is triggered at the very beginning of the game (after the game finishes loading, don’t wait for the green start button is pressed). This is used to compute things like time spent in game.

args.info: the number of the round that is about to start
args.name: starting_round_number

args.info: the target value for this round.
args.name: round_target_value

args.info: The positions of the holes
args.name: hole_positions

args.info: the options for the player to choose from (position, and value)
args.name: answer_choices

args.info: the type of objects on display
args.name: object_type

args.info: the number of the round that has just been completed
args.name: beat_round_number

2040.info: This marks the start of a particular level of difficulty.

args.info: the number of the level that is about to start
args.name: starting_level_number

args.info: the target value for this round
args.name: round_target_value

args.info: The positions of the holes
args.name: hole_positions

args.info: the options for the player to choose from (position, and value)
args.name: answer_choices

args.info: the type of objects on display
args.name: object_type

2050.info: Fires when a level is completed.

args.info: the number of the level that has just been completed
args.name: beat_level_number

3010.info: The system-initiated instruction event occurs when the game delivers instructions to the player. It contains information that describes the content of the instruction. This event differs from events 3020 and 3021 as it captures instructions that are not given in response to player action. These events are used to determine the effectiveness of the instructions. We can answer questions like, “did players who received instruction X do better than those who did not?” As an example, the initial tutorial instructions for the game would trigger this event.

args.info: the type of media that has just played: 'audio' || 'animation' || 'other'
args.name: media_type

args.info: the text or description of the instruction
args.name: description

args.info: a unique identifier for this piece of instruction
args.name: identifier

args.info: the estimated duration of the media playback in milliseconds (if it ran uninterrupted)
args.name: total_duration

args.info: the type of media that has just played: 'audio' || 'animation' || 'other'
args.name: media_type

args.name: description

args.info: a unique identifier for this piece of instruction
args.name: identifier

args.info: the estimated duration of the media playback in milliseconds (if it ran uninterrupted)
args.name: total_duration

args.info: the type of media that has just played: 'audio' || 'animation' || 'other'
args.name: media_type

args.info: the text or description of the instruction
args.name: description

args.info: a unique identifier for this piece of instruction
args.name: identifier

args.info: the estimated duration of the media playback in milliseconds (if it ran uninterrupted)
args.name: total_duration

args.info: the type of media that has just played: 'audio' || 'animation' || 'other'
args.name: media_type

args.info: the duration of the media playback in milliseconds

args.info: the text or description of the instruction

3120.info: End of System-Initiated Feedback (INCORRECT ROUND ATTEMPT)

args.info: the type of media that has just played: 'audio' || 'animation' || 'other'
args.name: media_type

args.name: duration

args.info: the text or description of the instruction

3121.info: End of System-Initiated Feedback (CORRECT ROUND ATTEMPT)

args.info: the type of media that has just played: 'audio' || 'animation' || 'other'
args.name: media_type

args.info: the duration of the media playback in milliseconds
args.name: duration

args.info: the text or description of the instruction

args.info: the number of the level that is about to start
args.name: starting_level_number

4020.info: Fires when a number-answer is clicked.

args.info: the target value for this round.
args.name: round_target_value

args.info: the value of the number clicked
args.name: number_clicked

args.info: the position of the object (number, from left to right)
args.name: position

args.info: Is this the correct number?
args.name: correct

4090.info: Game state when HELP is clicked.

args.info: the target value for this round.
args.name: round_target_value

ClickStart.description: Click the green button to start.

Intro1.description: Welcome to the museum! Each exhibit should have 10 things, but some are missing!

Intro2.description: Click the number below to tell George how many more things are needed so that 10 are on display.

Instruct3.description: How many more do we need so that we have 10 altogether?

Correct1.description: You're right! Now all ten are on display!

Correct2.description: That's it! This exhibit now has all ten things!

Correct3.description: Thank you! This display of ten looks perfect.

Correct4.description: Perfect. This exhibit is complete with all ten things.

Correct5.description: That's right!  This exhibit looks great with all ten pieces!

TooMany1.description: Oh, I'm afraid not. That's too many.

HowMany.description: So, how many things do we need to fill these empty spaces?

HowManySpace.description: So, how many things do we need to fill this empty space?

ProfClickKeepPlay.description: Click the green button to keep playing.
